summary: The U.S. food supply is generally considered safe, but foodborne illness—such as salmonella poisoning—remains a common problem. For some meat and poultry products such as ground beef, there are standards for how much harmful bacteria USDA can find when testing. However, some common products such as turkey breasts and pork chops don't have such standards. It's unclear how USDA decides which products to consider for...
title: Food Safety: USDA Should Take Further Action to Reduce Pathogens in Meat and Poultry Products
